content: Five Thousand Men Fed
After these things Jesus went away to the other side of the Sea of Galilee ( Tiberias).
A large crowd was following Him, because they were watching the signs which He was performing on those who were sick.
But Jesus went up on the mountain, and there He sat with His disciples.
Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was near.
So Jesus, after raising His eyes and seeing that a large crowd was coming to Him, *said to Philip,
But He was saying this  to test him, for He Himself knew what He intended to do.
Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not enough for them, for each to receive  a little!”
One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, *said to Him,
“There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish; but what are these for so many ?”
Jesus said,  Now there was plenty of grass in the place. So the men reclined, about five thousand in number.
Jesus then took the loaves, and after giving thanks He distributed  to those who were reclining; likewise also of the fish, as much as they wanted.
And when they had eaten their fill, He *said to His disciples,
So they gathered them up, and filled twelve baskets with pieces from the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten.
Therefore when the people saw the sign which He had performed, they said, “This is truly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
Jesus Walks on the Water
So Jesus, aware that they intended to come and take Him by force to make Him king, withdrew again to the mountain by Himself, alone.
Now when evening came, His disciples went down to the sea,
and after getting into a boat, they  cross the sea to Capernaum. It had already become dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.
In addition, the sea  getting rough, because a strong wind was blowing.
Then, when they had rowed about twenty-five or thirty stadia, they *saw Jesus walking on the sea and coming near the boat; and they were frightened.
But He *said to them,
So they were willing to take Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land to which they were going.

The next day the crowd that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other small boat there except one, and that Jesus had not gotten into the boat with His disciples, but  His disciples had departed alone.
Other small boats came from Tiberias near to the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
So when the crowd saw that Jesus was not there, nor His disciples, they themselves got into the small boats and came to Capernaum, looking for Jesus.
And when they found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, “Rabbi, when did You get here?”
Words to the People
Jesus answered them and said,
Therefore they said to Him, “What are we to do, so that we may accomplish the works of God?”
Jesus answered and said to them,
So they said to Him, “What then are You doing as a sign, so that we may see, and believe You? What work are You performing?
Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness; as it is written: ‘.’”
Jesus then said to them,
Then they said to Him, “Lord, always give us this bread.”
Jesus said to them,
Words to the Jews
So then the Jews were complaining about Him because He said,
And they were saying, “Is this not Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How does He now say, ?”
Jesus answered and said to them,
Then the Jews  to argue with one another, saying, “How can this man give us His flesh to eat?”
So Jesus said to them,
Words to the Disciples
These things He said in the synagogue as He taught in Capernaum.
So then many of His disciples, when they heard , said, “This statement is  unpleasant; who can listen to it?”
But Jesus, aware that His disciples were complaining about this, said to them,  For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who it was who would betray Him.
And He was saying,
Peter’s Confession of Faith
As a result of this many of His disciples left, and would no longer walk with Him.
So Jesus said to the twelve,
Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have words of eternal life.
And we have  believed and have come to know that You are the Holy One of God.”
Jesus answered them,
Now He meant Judas  of Simon Iscariot; for he, one of the twelve, was going to betray Him.
